question: Where are Goblet cells localized?
ideal_answer: Goblet cells are found in the intestine, in the lungs, in the eyes etc. Goblet cells are localized in the epithelium.

snippets.text: Goblet cells (GCs) and endocrine cells (ECs) play an important role in intestine physiology,
Conjunctival goblet cells (CGCs) are specialized cells that produce and secrete soluble mucins to the tear film that bathes the ocular surface.
The epithelial lining of the small intestine consists of multiple cell types, including Paneth cells and goblet cells, that work in cohort to maintain gut health.
goblet cell numbers are increased within the airway epithelium
The mucosa is lined with a stratified secretory epithelium rich in goblet cells that secrete neutral and acid mucins.
